content:
Check:
  all:
    - context: DOMAIN
      name: RDOMAIN
      operator: is_not_valid_reference
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0373
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when SUPP--.RDOMAIN does not represent a dataset present
  in the study
Outcome:
  Message: SUPP--.RDOMAIN does not represent a dataset present in the study
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Study
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0373
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: There is a one-to-one correspondence between a domain
                  dataset and it's Supplemental Qualifier dataset by creating one
                  SUPPQUAL for each domain dataset. The single SUPPQUAL dataset option
                  that was introduced in SDTMIG v3.1.1 is now deprecated.  The set
                  of Supplemental Qualifiers for each domain is included in a separate
                  dataset with the name SUPP-- where “--“ denotes the source domain
                  which the supplemental Qualifiers relate back to.
                Document: IG v3.2
                Section: 8.4.2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SUPP

json.Description: Trigger error when SUPP--.RDOMAIN does not represent a dataset present in the study

Outcome.Message: SUPP--.RDOMAIN does not represent a dataset present in the study

Citations.Cited_Guidance: There is a one-to-one correspondence between a domain dataset and it's Supplemental Qualifier dataset by creating one SUPPQUAL for each domain dataset. The single SUPPQUAL dataset option that was introduced in SDTMIG v3.1.1 is now deprecated.  The set of Supplemental Qualifiers for each domain is included in a separate dataset with the name SUPP-- where “--“ denotes the source domain which the supplemental Qualifiers relate back to.
